headline: What leadership changes mean for consumer brands like Coca-Cola
summary: Coca-Cola (KO) has named Henrique Braun to be the company's next CEO after current chief executive James Quincey steps down from the role at the end of March 2026. Braun is currently the EVP and Chief Operating Officer of The Coca‑Cola Company. A panel consisting of Northwestern Mutual Wealth Management Company CIO Brent Schutte and Yahoo Finance senior reporters Brooke DiPalma and Ines Ferré comment on the changing landscape for consumer brands as Coke becomes the latest company to be welcoming new CEOs. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Attention Target Shoppers: Kris K.'s Top Tips to Win the Final Days of Holiday Shopping
summary: Santa's just like the rest of us: Sometimes he checks his list twice and discovers one more gift to buy, and not a lot of time to buy it. The good news: Target Corporation (NYSE: TGT) is ready to deliver all the joy — from shopping ease, to inspiring, on-trend gifts, to deals that practically wrap themselves. Think of it as a sleigh ride, but with better parking.

headline: 1 Cash-Producing Stock to Target This Week and 2 Facing Challenges
summary: A company that generates cash isn’t automatically a winner. Some businesses stockpile cash but fail to reinvest wisely, limiting their ability to expand.
